trans-unit.source: Clip Values
trans-unit.target: Clip Values

trans-unit.source: Detects outliers and clips or replaces their values
trans-unit.target: Detects outliers and clips or replaces their values

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="345C5ED4-4DD6-4998-9773-6CA0E00E6946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Scale and Reduce</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="345C5ED4-4DD6-4998-9773-6CA0E00E6946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Scale and Reduce</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Clip Values</ui> module to identify and optionally replace data values that are above or below a specified threshold.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Clip Values</ui> module to identify and optionally replace data values that are above or below a specified threshold.

trans-unit.source: This is useful when you want to remove outliers or replace them with a mean, or threshold value.
trans-unit.target: This is useful when you want to remove outliers or replace them with a mean, or threshold value.

trans-unit.source: There are multiple ways to identify values for clipping: you can set a value to use as the upper or lower boundary, or you can specify a percentile range.
trans-unit.target: There are multiple ways to identify values for clipping: you can set a value to use as the upper or lower boundary, or you can specify a percentile range.

trans-unit.source: All values outside the range are replaced or removed using the method you specify.
trans-unit.target: All values outside the range are replaced or removed using the method you specify.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Clip Values
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Clip Values

trans-unit.source: Select the columns to work with.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns to work with.

trans-unit.source: Since you can apply only one kind of transformation at a time, you might need to use multiple instances of <ui>Clip Values</ui> to adjust different types of numeric data.
trans-unit.target: Since you can apply only one kind of transformation at a time, you might need to use multiple instances of <ui>Clip Values</ui> to adjust different types of numeric data.

trans-unit.source: Indicate the method that you want to apply when identifying target values.
trans-unit.target: Indicate the method that you want to apply when identifying target values.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ClipPeak</ui> looks for and then replaces or removes values that are greater than a specified upper boundary value.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ClipPeak</ui> looks for and then replaces or removes values that are greater than a specified upper boundary value.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ClipSubpeaks</ui> looks for and then replaces or removes values that are less than the specified lower boundary value.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ClipSubpeaks</ui> looks for and then replaces or removes values that are less than the specified lower boundary value.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ClipPeaksAndSubpeaks</ui> applies both a lower and upper boundary on values, and replaces or removes all values that are outside the specified range.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ClipPeaksAndSubpeaks</ui> applies both a lower and upper boundary on values, and replaces or removes all values that are outside the specified range.

trans-unit.source: Specify a threshold or boundary value to use.
trans-unit.target: Specify a threshold or boundary value to use.

trans-unit.source: You can type a constant, meaning a hard-coded maximum or minimum value, or you can specify a percentile value.
trans-unit.target: You can type a constant, meaning a hard-coded maximum or minimum value, or you can specify a percentile value.

trans-unit.source: Values that exactly match the boundary value are considered in the range and will not be replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Values that exactly match the boundary value are considered in the range and will not be replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: For all numbers that will be changed, specify a replacement value.
trans-unit.target: For all numbers that will be changed, specify a replacement value.

trans-unit.source: You can replace numbers outside the boundary values with the specified threshold value, with a mean, or with a median.
trans-unit.target: You can replace numbers outside the boundary values with the specified threshold value, with a mean, or with a median.

trans-unit.source: You can also remove the values by replacing them with a missing (or empty) value.
trans-unit.target: You can also remove the values by replacing them with a missing (or empty) value.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the way that numeric values are clipped by using the following options.
trans-unit.target: You can customize the way that numeric values are clipped by using the following options.

trans-unit.source: Clip Values by Peaks
trans-unit.target: Clip Values by Peaks

trans-unit.source: When you select the option <ui>ClipPeaks</ui>, you specify only an upper boundary.
trans-unit.target: When you select the option <ui>ClipPeaks</ui>, you specify only an upper boundary.

trans-unit.source: Values greater than that boundary value are replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Values greater than that boundary value are replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: Upper threshold
trans-unit.target: Upper threshold

trans-unit.source: Define the value you want to use as the upper boundary for values.
trans-unit.target: Define the value you want to use as the upper boundary for values.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to specify a single value that defines the upper boundary.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to specify a single value that defines the upper boundary.

trans-unit.source: Then, type the value to use in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value for upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Then, type the value to use in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value for upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: Values that are equal to the boundary value are not clipped.
trans-unit.target: Values that are equal to the boundary value are not clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.

trans-unit.source: Then, type the upper percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile value for upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Then, type the upper percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile value for upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for some examples of how these values work.
trans-unit.target: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for some examples of how these values work.

trans-unit.source: Upper substitute value
trans-unit.target: Upper substitute value

trans-unit.source: The substitute value replaces all column values that are greater than the specified threshold.
trans-unit.target: The substitute value replaces all column values that are greater than the specified threshold.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.

trans-unit.source: The mean is computed before values are clipped.
trans-unit.target: The mean is computed before values are clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.

trans-unit.source: Clip Values by SubPeaks
trans-unit.target: Clip Values by SubPeaks

trans-unit.source: When you select the option <ui>ClipSubPeaks</ui>, you specify only a lower boundary.
trans-unit.target: When you select the option <ui>ClipSubPeaks</ui>, you specify only a lower boundary.

trans-unit.source: Values that are less than that boundary value are replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Values that are less than that boundary value are replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: Lower threshold
trans-unit.target: Lower threshold

trans-unit.source: Define the value you want to use as the lower boundary for values.
trans-unit.target: Define the value you want to use as the lower boundary for values.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to specify a single value that defines the lower boundary.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to specify a single value that defines the lower boundary.

trans-unit.source: Then, type the value to use in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value for lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Then, type the value to use in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value for lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: Values that are equal to or greater than the boundary value are not clipped.
trans-unit.target: Values that are equal to or greater than the boundary value are not clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.

trans-unit.source: Then, type the lower percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile value for lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Then, type the lower percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile value for lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for some examples of how these values work.
trans-unit.target: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for some examples of how these values work.

trans-unit.source: Lower substitute value
trans-unit.target: Lower substitute value

trans-unit.source: The substitute value replaces all column values that are less than the specified threshold.
trans-unit.target: The substitute value replaces all column values that are less than the specified threshold.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.

trans-unit.source: The mean is computed before values are clipped.
trans-unit.target: The mean is computed before values are clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.

trans-unit.source: Clip Values by Peaks and SubPeaks
trans-unit.target: Clip Values by Peaks and SubPeaks

trans-unit.source: When you select the option <ui>ClipPeaksSubpeaks</ui>, you can specify both the upper and lower boundaries.
trans-unit.target: When you select the option <ui>ClipPeaksSubpeaks</ui>, you can specify both the upper and lower boundaries.

trans-unit.source: Values that are outside that range are replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Values that are outside that range are replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: Values that match the boundary values are not changed.
trans-unit.target: Values that match the boundary values are not changed.

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: You specify a single method for defining the upper and lower boundary values (either a constant or percentile), and then type the boundary values.
trans-unit.target: You specify a single method for defining the upper and lower boundary values (either a constant or percentile), and then type the boundary values.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Constant</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to specify the exact values for the upper and lower boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to specify the exact values for the upper and lower boundaries.

trans-unit.source: Type the number to use as the <legacyBold>upper</legacyBold> boundary in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value of upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Type the number to use as the <legacyBold>upper</legacyBold> boundary in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value of upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: Column values that are greater than this number will be replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Column values that are greater than this number will be replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: Column values that match this number will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: Column values that match this number will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: Type the number to use as the <legacyBold>lower</legacyBold> boundary in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value of lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Type the number to use as the <legacyBold>lower</legacyBold> boundary in the <legacyItalic><ui>Constant value of lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: Column values that are less than this number will be replaced or removed.
trans-unit.target: Column values that are less than this number will be replaced or removed.

trans-unit.source: Column values that match this number will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: Column values that match this number will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentiles</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Percentiles</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to constrain the column values to a percentile range.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to keep only the values in the 10-80 percentile range, and replace all others with a mean.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to keep only the values in the 10-80 percentile range, and replace all others with a mean.

trans-unit.source: Then, type the upper percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile number of upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Then, type the upper percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile number of upper threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: Type the lower percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile number of lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.
trans-unit.target: Type the lower percentile range value in the <legacyItalic><ui>Percentile number of lower threshold</ui></legacyItalic> text box.

trans-unit.source: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for examples of how percentile ranges work.
trans-unit.target: See the section on <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Percentiles" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">percentiles</legacyLink> for examples of how percentile ranges work.

trans-unit.source: Substitute value for peaks
trans-unit.target: Substitute value for peaks

trans-unit.source: This substitute value replaces all column values that are greater than the specified threshold.
trans-unit.target: This substitute value replaces all column values that are greater than the specified threshold.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.

trans-unit.source: The mean is computed before values are clipped.
trans-unit.target: The mean is computed before values are clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.

trans-unit.source: Substitute value for subpeaks
trans-unit.target: Substitute value for subpeaks

trans-unit.source: This substitute value replaces all column values that are less than the specified threshold.
trans-unit.target: This substitute value replaces all column values that are less than the specified threshold.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Threshold</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the specified threshold value.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Mean</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the mean of the column values.

trans-unit.source: The mean is computed before values are clipped.
trans-unit.target: The mean is computed before values are clipped.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Median</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the median of the column values before clipping.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Missing</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.
trans-unit.target: Replaces clipped values with the missing (empty) value.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available no matter which means of clipping you choose.
trans-unit.target: The following options are available no matter which means of clipping you choose.

trans-unit.source: List of columns
trans-unit.target: List of columns

trans-unit.source: Click to use the Column Selector to choose the columns to which <ui>Clip Values</ui> will be applied.
trans-unit.target: Click to use the Column Selector to choose the columns to which <ui>Clip Values</ui> will be applied.

trans-unit.source: Overwrite flag
trans-unit.target: Overwrite flag

trans-unit.source: By default, <ui>Clip Values</ui> constructs a new column with the peak values clipped to the desired threshold with the new values overwriting the original column.
trans-unit.target: By default, <ui>Clip Values</ui> constructs a new column with the peak values clipped to the desired threshold with the new values overwriting the original column.

trans-unit.source: To keep the original column and add a new column with the clipped values, deselect this option.
trans-unit.target: To keep the original column and add a new column with the clipped values, deselect this option.

trans-unit.source: Add indicator columns
trans-unit.target: Add indicator columns

trans-unit.source: You can also generate an indicator column that tells you whether or not a clipping operation would be applied to the data in each row.
trans-unit.target: You can also generate an indicator column that tells you whether or not a clipping operation would be applied to the data in each row.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Using Clip Values with Percentiles
trans-unit.target: Using Clip Values with Percentiles

trans-unit.source: To understand how clipping by percentiles works, consider a dataset with 10 rows, which have one instance each of the values 1-10.
trans-unit.target: To understand how clipping by percentiles works, consider a dataset with 10 rows, which have one instance each of the values 1-10.

trans-unit.source: If you are using percentile as the upper threshold, at the value for the 90th percentile, 90 percent of all values in the dataset must be less than that value.
trans-unit.target: If you are using percentile as the upper threshold, at the value for the 90th percentile, 90 percent of all values in the dataset must be less than that value.

trans-unit.source: If you are using percentile as the lower threshold, at the value for the 10th percentile, 10 percent of all values in the dataset must be less than that value.
trans-unit.target: If you are using percentile as the lower threshold, at the value for the 10th percentile, 10 percent of all values in the dataset must be less than that value.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Set of thresholds</ui>, choose <ui>ClipPeaksAndSubPeaks</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Set of thresholds</ui>, choose <ui>ClipPeaksAndSubPeaks</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Upper threshold</ui>, choose <ui>Percentile</ui>, and for <ui>Percentile number</ui>, type 90.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Upper threshold</ui>, choose <ui>Percentile</ui>, and for <ui>Percentile number</ui>, type 90.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Upper substitute value</ui>, choose <ui>Missing Value</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Upper substitute value</ui>, choose <ui>Missing Value</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Lower threshold</ui>, choose <ui>Percentile</ui>, and for <ui>Percentile number</ui>, type 10.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Lower threshold</ui>, choose <ui>Percentile</ui>, and for <ui>Percentile number</ui>, type 10.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Lower substitute value</ui>, choose <ui>Missing Value</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Lower substitute value</ui>, choose <ui>Missing Value</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Deselect the option <ui>Overwrite flag</ui>, and select the option, <ui>Add indicator column</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Deselect the option <ui>Overwrite flag</ui>, and select the option, <ui>Add indicator column</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Now try the same experiment using 60 as the upper percentile threshold and 30 as the lower percentile threshold, and use the threshold value as the replacement value.
trans-unit.target: Now try the same experiment using 60 as the upper percentile threshold and 30 as the lower percentile threshold, and use the threshold value as the replacement value.

trans-unit.source: The following table compares these two results:
trans-unit.target: The following table compares these two results:

trans-unit.source: Replace with missing; Upper threshold = 90; Lower threshold = 10
trans-unit.target: Replace with missing; Upper threshold = 90; Lower threshold = 10

trans-unit.target: Replace with threshold; Upper percentile = 60; Lower percentile = 30

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: You can use <ui>Clip Values</ui> only on columns containing numbers or datetime values.
trans-unit.target: You can use <ui>Clip Values</ui> only on columns containing numbers or datetime values.

trans-unit.source: If you include columns that have text or categorical data, the columns will be skipped.
trans-unit.target: If you include columns that have text or categorical data, the columns will be skipped.

trans-unit.source: Missing values are ignored when the mean or median value is computed for a column.
trans-unit.target: Missing values are ignored when the mean or median value is computed for a column.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Clip Values</ui> does not support ordinal data.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Clip Values</ui> does not support ordinal data.

trans-unit.source: Missing values are not altered when they are propagated to the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: Missing values are not altered when they are propagated to the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: The column indicating clipped values always contains FALSE for missing values.
trans-unit.target: The column indicating clipped values always contains FALSE for missing values.
